posts.message:
Via Mohamed A. Baset

قبل التحدى اللى جاى، دا بوست كدا ملوش اى تلاتين لازمه تجميعه لكل البوستات اللى كتبتها قبل كدا عن السكيوريتى والثغرات "من اول بوست لأخر بوست" واللى كان هاشتاج بعنوان #ثغرة_وحكاية ، اعملوله Bookmark او Save او Copy بس مع حفظ الحقوق او اعملوا نفسكم مش شايفينه عادى 
-دا بوست بيشرح ويوضح البدء فى تعلم لغات البرمجة الخاصة بالويب والموبايل وكيفية البداية فى دخول مجال اختبار الاختراق "بإمكانك تجاهل اى جزء والبدء مباشرة فى الاخر"

posts.message:
Hey everyone, my laptop (lenovo z570 with a couple of upgrades) is failing fast (in terms of MB failures, outer chaises ugly screen resolution.... :D), and I believe it's about time for a new one. However, the issue is, with my second gen core-i5, 8GB of RAM, and a recently bought Samsung SSD on my current system, I'm generally satisfied and most of the available laptops I've seen don't really look like a true upgrade. So, I started considering a Mac Book Pro... and then I started wondering if there are better choices that I can buy for >15K. I'm pretty sure the PC world has a lot to offer for that price range. so, simply put, the question is, why should/shouldn't I buy a mac, and if not a mac, which laptop do you recommend for running ubuntu (sorry windows guys, unless I'm running OS X, there is nothing else I can use other than Linux :D) 

--p.s. I know it's a controversial thing, and some people take it so religiously, but I need to buy a new laptop not start a flame war :P

posts.description: Answer: I am not sure, but you may need to develop a filter driver. Check out KMDF documentation at MSDN. Every request to a device driver passes through filter driver.
